TA1022-d-02-07-89-DRGW.Accident Cause: Speed, other (Provide detailed description in narrative)
TA1022-d-02-07-89-DRGW.Narrative: AT APPROXIMATELY 12:55 AM., FEB 7, 1989, BROKEN KNUCKLE BETWEEN SEVENTH AND EIGHT CAR BEHIND LOCOMOTIVE OCURRED AT APPROXIMATELY MILE POST 284. HEAD BRAKEMAN AFTER MUCH DIFFICULTY IN HIS ATTEMPT TO REPLACE BROKEN KNUCKLE DISCOVERED HE WAS ATTEMPTING TO PUT AN "F" KNUCKLE INTO AN "E" COUPLER. WHEN PROPER KNUCKLE WAS SECURED FROM LOCOMOTIVE, BROKEN KNUCKLE WAS THEN CHANGED WITHOUT FURTHER TROUBLE. THE AMOUNT OF TIME SPENT WAS OVER SEVENTY MINUTES. THE DETACHED PORTION OF THE TRAIN WHICH CONSISTEDOF 53 CARS AND 3 HELPER LOCOMOTIVE UNITS STATED MOVING BACKWARDS AND EVENTUALLY ACHIEVED A SPEED OF63 MPH DUE TO INADEQUATE BRAKING FOR THE THREE PERCENT GRADE. THE BRAKING WAS INADEQUATE DUE TO INSUFFICIENT HAND BRAKES SET AND THE NORMAL LEAK OFF OF AIR BRAKES OVER A PERIOD OF SEVENTY MINUTES. THEDETACHED PORTION OF THE TRAIN EXCEEDED SPEED (APROXIMATELY 50 MPH) AT WHICH COVERED HOPPER CAR LOADS OF SODA ASH WILL TURN OVER IN SEVEN OR EIGHT DEGREE CURVES. THE GROUP OF COVERED HOPPERS IN THE REAR OF THE TRAIN PASSED THE EIGHT DEGREE SIXTEEN MINUTE CURVE AT MILE POST 286.3 BEFORE TURNOVER SPEED WAS ACHIEVED.NoneNoneNone

TA1021-d-02-05-89-DRGW.Narrative: TRAIN J-SLE1-05, BN EXTRA 7243 SOUTH, AT APPROXIMATELY MILE POST 58, TRAVELLING OUT OF CONTROL AT APPROXIMATELY 43 MPH, ENGINEER REVERSED THE LOCOMOTIVE IN AN ATTEMPT TO STOP THE TRAIN. AS THE RESULTOF THE LOCOMOTIVES BEING REVERSED, THE WHEELS LOCKED UP ON THE BN 7243. TRAIN CONTINUED TO GAIN SPEED AND OVER A PERIOD OF SOME 12 MILES DEVELOPED 14-INCH FLAT SPOTS RESULTING IN A FALSE FLANGE. WHENLOCOMOTIVE PASSED OVER A TRAILING POINT HAND THROW SWITCH AT MILE POST 70.8, THE WHEELS WITH THE FALSE FLANGE CAUSED THE STOCK RAIL TO BE PARTIALLY TURNED OVER WHICH RESULTED IN THOSE WHEELS AND ALL WHEELS BEHIND TO DROP INSIDE THE STOCK RAIL RESULTING IN THE DERAILMENT.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone
